intro: Galium tricornutum, commonly known as the three-angled bedstraw, is a herbaceous perennial plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems and small, opposite leaves that are typically ovate or elliptic in shape. The plant produces clusters of tiny, white or pale yellow flowers, which are usually arranged in cymes. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodland floors and stream banks. Galium tricornutum is often found in temperate regions of Europe and parts of Asia.
